name: Numeric
description: The NM data type is used to represent numeric values including integers and decimal numbers. It allows for positive and negative numbers and supports decimal places for precision. Used throughout HL7 for quantities, measurements, counts, and other numeric data.

constraints.format: ASCII digits 0-9, optional decimal point, optional leading + or - sign
constraints.decimal: Decimal point (.) allowed for fractional values
constraints.signs: Leading + or - signs allowed for positive/negative values
constraints.scientific: Scientific notation (E notation) is not typically used in HL7 v2.3

usage: Numeric observation values in OBX.5 - Observation Value
Birth order in PID.25 - Birth Order
Guarantor priority in GT1.1 - Guarantor Number
Ages, weights, heights, and other measurements

generationHints.typical: Use appropriate numeric values for the healthcare context
generationHints.precision: Use appropriate decimal places for the measurement type
generationHints.avoid: Do not use commas as thousands separators

validationRules.required: Must contain at least one digit
validationRules.length: Maximum 16 characters including sign and decimal point
validationRules.overflow: Implementations should handle numeric overflow appropriately
